pageContext.description: Looped palstave, with median ridge:flanges -3' maximum depth at stop-ridge.Section at edge of blade ///: thickness along edge XXX
pageContext.other: Measurements originally in inches: Length '5.8', Width '1.2"', Thickness '1-1',5 cross section drawings of palstave on reverse with text at stop-ridge drawing "Section across stop ridge and flanges.",Loop appears intact.,Strong midrib connected to stop running most of the way down face of blade but ending before edge.,Butt broken and missing with angular break in septum.
pageContext.associations: No definite association, but possible part of a leaf-shaped sword.
pageContext.publications: Transactions of the Essex Archaeological Society, Vol. 19 (N.S) pp.311-13,Illus.
pageContext.site: essex,southchurch,thorpe hall brickfield.,found while digging brickearth. other bronze implements from the same depth at same brickfield. 1929
pageContext.remarks: Prepared by: D.G. Macleod, Assistant-in-Charge, Prittlewell Priory Museum. June 1958.
